title: Display sans font with sparkle / starlight
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317121731im_/http:/typophile.com/files/00000082_4608.png)

Tried WhatTheFont and WhatFontIs, also googled "font starlight" or "font sparkle".  
A little closed to "Theory" by Trevor Scobie but still not the same.

Anyone know the font name or some suggestion? Thanks.

Best Regards,  
Chien

Font: 

 Planetarium 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317121731/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")
author: cwchien

comments.content:
According to Luc Devroye this is **Planetarium** free font by Yoshihisa Nakai [Typing Art, 2009]:  
 [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-33751.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317121731/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-33751.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-33751.html")

This is the official page but it's all Japanese to me:  
 [http://typingart.net/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317121731/http:/typingart.net/ "http://typingart.net/")

akira1975,

I could only list one username on the "solved by" field.  
System prevents me saving with two usernames split by comma.

Since it's just one minute, you are also the solver in my mind.  
Thanks again to both of you.

Best Regards,  
Chien
